title: Man wanted in weekend block party shooting turns himself in
content:
JACKSON, MS (Mississippi News Now) -
Police say the man wanted in a weekend block party shooting has turned himself in.
22-year-old Ryan Davis is charged with six counts of aggravated assault stemming from the October 28 shooting. Six people were shot and several others injured.
RELATED: JPD releases video of suspected shooter responsible for injuring 6 people Friday
All the injured are in stable condition with non-life threatening injuries.
Police say the block party shooting happened on Lorenz Boulevard near West Street. On Sunday, the Jackson Police Department released video of the suspected shooter and asked for the public's help in identifying the person.
If you have any additional information about this shooting, please contact JPD.
